Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; faint traces of added white bands and possibly a lotus bud; exterior: painted decoration consisting of standing sphinx to right (part of body with added red patches and row of dots on underbelly, hind leg and wing with red patch remaining); dot rosette as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 258, no. 487)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0501) (phase 2)
